test1.content: Hi,  I have a query and an experience to share.  As you must know that a FREE user can only put a maximum of 200 Items in his/her sway. Whereas if you are an Office 365 subscriber there is no such limit or maybe there is of about 1500 items, I am not sure.   But let me tell you what my concern is: Recently I had to create a presentation regarding my college project. So I found this as a perfect opportunity to try it. It took me a little while to get to know the interface and know how it works. And while I was in between creating my presentation, there came an error stating that I had reached my limit of 200 Items and to continue creating my sway  I would have to subscribe to Office 365. At first I was a little worried because the next day was the deadline for the submission of my project and this issue was wasting my valuable time. But seeing no other option I immediately went to grab my credit card  and subscribed myself to Office 365 Home. And then there I was back to creating my presentation without any worries. I was able to complete the presentation and submit it the next day. By the way it went wonderful, the teacher liked it a lot.  A few days went. One day while I was scrolling through my emails, I found one regarding the next deduction of the my monthly subscription of Office 365. Then I wondered why I was wasting my valuable money each month when I was already  over with my work. So I immediately went towards cancelling my subscription. And just when I was about to click on the cancel button, there hit me something in the mind.  "What will happen to my existing sway once I cancel the subscription?"  I wondered many scenarios:  Maybe the whole sway will get deletedMaybe it'll be cut in half i.e. only the first 200 Items would remain and the rest won'tMaybe nothing will happen, I will have my sway forever. While I was thinking about the consequences I remembered that I would be needing this sway in the future.  Since I was not using my Office 365 Home subscription for anything else except sway, I thought of it as a waste of money. But, before coming to any conclusion I thought to better search about this issue online and was pretty confident about finding an answer immediately   But my assumption turned out to be way more than just wrong. I couldn't find anything regarding my issue anywhere on the several support pages of Microsoft. I even went through all the FAQs. But no answer. Then I thought to contact Microsoft Support about it. First I went in chat with an Answer Tech. What that person basically told me was that there was no such thing as Sway in Office 365 Home and also that he/she was unable to find anything regarding that issue in their databases so, they were unable help me.  Also this chat between us went for about an hour or so because of their delay in replying. I don't know how many persons does one Answer Tech handle at a time.  Then I thought it would be better to have a one on one talk with a support person. So I went into another feature "Call Me As Soon As Possible". It showed me that I would receive a call after a minute, but no one called. I gave it another try a few hours later hoping to get a call this time. But again no one called. I then tried this again the next day, but still  no one called. And what was surprising was that, every time it showed me that I would receive a call after a certain minutes. All of this what I did was in their business hours as mentioned by them on their website. Later I went for another feature "Schedule a Call". And you know what, the same story happened again. which I don't wanna repeat.  Tired from not finding any solution I thought to gave up. But after getting over with the frustrations of the last experience. I thought to gave it another try. So I went looking for an alternate way to contact support. And I thought it would be the best  to myself call the Microsoft Support. So in search for a number to call, I again got in chat with an answer tech and straight away asked them for a number rather than explaining the whole issue. Since I live in India so, they gave me the support numbers for my country. What I figured out later was that all the numbers were basically the same i.e. all of them redirected towards one location. And so finally I had a chat with someone on the phone who at first seemed like qualified person. But I was disappointed as they too gave the same excuse, even they didn't had any solution to my query in their databases. Also they gave me another number,  which they said would be the best place to get the help as those people (on that number) were more qualified than them. Without thinking I dialed the number. And what that number turned out to be was of the Microsoft's American Support center. After getting connected to an American support executive, he/she refused to help me stating that I should call on the numbers for  my country, And gave me those same numbers that were given to me by that answer tech.  But, This time I was determined on finding a solution. So I called again on those Indian numbers. Again told them my trouble and again received the same response as earlier, asking me to contact on that same American number as earlier. I even told them that  I already did so. But they kept on saying they were not that qualified.  As I mentioned earlier that this time I was determined. So I called them back again on that American support number. The person on the other side this time said the SAME thing again. Now this was getting me angry. But I was determined , So I called back again on the same number hoping that this time some other person might help me. This time the support executive told me that  they only handle Office 365 Business subscribers and if I am one then only they could help me otherwise they had another solution for me. Now guess what that solution could be.........YES YOU ARE CORRECT..!! THOSE INDIAN NUMBERS AGAIN.    Now here I am at present. Days have past and what I only have with me are those numbers and my pending query which I didn't expected to be that unique. test1.content: Until very recently, the style I have chosen for my Sways (Style 2, Variation 2 -- I think; Layout = Scrolls Vertically) presented the text in a half-column down the left half of the page, with single pictures often in the right column next to the text.  Groups were sometimes below, and that's OK. Most pictures were of a discreet size -- large enough to see, but not so large as to overwhelm or even to take up the whole viewing area.  But just a few days ago, this changed and now my Sways appear as centered text (about 2/3 of the screen width) with all pictures following the text, and some of quite large, much larger than I would prefer to see.  I am fairly confident I have not made a change myself to the style -- because it has to be done in individual Sways, there being no way to store style changes -- and I have over 30 Sways in this series, and all are affected.  This change is visible in both Preview and Play mode, but not in full-screen play mode: then it reverts to what it used to be, and which I would prefer it to be.  So what gives? I am baffled. test1.content: I don't know under which cathegory THIS problem falls... Feel free to sort it where it belongs to.  Following thing happens very often:  I cannot rename a file or folder. It is not the permissions. It is allways explorer.exe locking the file. Logging off and back on solves the problem most of the time, so I can delete/rename the file from the explorer. In those cases where this does not work  I logoff/logon again, open a cmd.exe shell and delete the file there without problems.  The filetypes are .wma .wmv .mp3 .avi .jpg etc all typical media file types + a few others.  So the source of the problem is following behavior: Vista explorer.exe opens the file to read infos there, like extif info in .jpg files, like mp3-ID3-tag, etc etc. Can explorer.exe be prevented from opening those files for reading and checking information? Win XP a way to (partly) solve that was to unregister shmedia.dll, in Vista it seems to be "wmploc.DLL", but I would prefer a confirmation first.  This is even worse with .exe files, where Vista (and XP) allways open the file to check for the icon resource, so over slow network this leads to serious probelms.  The Questions are.. 1. How can it be prevented that Vista opens various media file types to check for their contents, and partly hang due to that (rename/delete preventing)? 2. Can it be prevented that Vista opens every .exe file to check for an icon resource, especially over VPN or ANY network connection? I do nearly all my (over VPN) filecopy stuff in a shell since I know that explorer will hang after a few seconds due to this  behavior.  KB956592 is already installed, it helps a bit, but really only a bit since it is not the folder browsing that makes it hang, it is the file-open action (especially with .exe).  Before you ask: I already did change one of the biggest vista annoyances (this .reg file should explain if by itself easier than doing it in words) so it does not check media file contents anyway due to "automatic folder type detection", but it still does open  those files when accidently hovering over such file, and therefore hangs on some files or make the undeletable and unrenameable.  That stuff is confirmed by the vista resource monitor and those godly sysinternals (now wininternals) tools, I see that explorer.exe is the culprit.  Don't worry, I still prefer Vista over XP : ), it is just that it needs (like XP and EVERY other OS too, no Linux exception here!) some adjustment for usability.  Set  ----------reg file against folder annoyance---------  Windows Registry Editor Version 5.00 [-HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Classes\Local Settings\Software\Microsoft\Windows\Shell\BagMRU] [HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Classes\Local Settings\Software\Microsoft\Windows\Shell\BagMRU] "NodeSlots"=hex:02 "MRUListEx"=hex:ff,ff,ff,ff "NodeSlot"=dword:0000000 [-HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Classes\Local Settings\Software\Microsoft\Windows\Shell\Bags] [HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Classes\Local Settings\Software\Microsoft\Windows\Shell\Bags] [HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Classes\Local Settings\Software\Microsoft\Windows\Shell] "BagMRU Size"=dword:00000800 [HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Classes\Local Settings\Software\Microsoft\Windows\Shell\Bags\AllFolders\Shell] "FolderType"="NotSpecified"
test1.title: explorer.exe prevents renaming, deleting etc of media files.

test1.content: Is running ChkDsk in Vista with the /f or /r parameter a risky business? What do you think? I have run foul of this "bug?" myself in the past which resulted in a restoring from a saved backup image, less luckier people have been forced to reformat and reinstall Vista. It is suggested to run it only in read only mode to see if there are any errors that need to be fixed first. A strange randomly occurring bug exists with ChkDsk and Vista when the /f or /r switches are used, that might destroy or re-write all the security  descriptors for nearly every in use file in Vista, with the outcome being an unbootable system.  Chkdsk "file 9" and what follows - walterouze http://www.eggheadcafe.com/software/aspnet/31697890/chkdsk-file-9-and-what.aspx http://www.google.com/search?q=Chkdsk+%22file+9%22%2Bvista&rls=com.microsoft:  This link is not directly related to Vista but explains the danger of using ChkDsk in Vista. The CHKDSK utility incorrectly identifies and deletes in-use security descriptors http://support.microsoft.com/kb/831374/en-us#appliesto  Any news from Microsoft or fixes for Vista?
test1.title: Is ChkDsk still a worry when run in Vista?

test1.content: I have Vista Ultimate X64. My biggest problem is getting daily system restore points. I found where they were being created intask scheduler afer noticing I did not have very many restore points like i did in XP. I noticed that the restore points at login were working ok but thescheduled task was not working regularly. I was shutting down my machine daily and it wouldthen wait for the next chance but failed often based on the history tab in task scheduler.  SoI disabled the taskthat ran at login,Ithoughtit should only create one at night, and changed the scheduled restore point to run at 1:30am and turned on "wake computer to run". I then started shutting down by clicking the low power state button option  under the start button.  It started working fine and i was getting one every night and they were building up. (The only way I found to see restore points is to actually start the restore process, isn't there a better way? ) I have 3 volumes and only the c: volume was turned on.  I decided to turn on the other 2 volumes. It wiped out all restore points I had. I guess I can see that.  But then after that it would act sporadically. Task scheduler was telling me it ran successfully every night via the history tab, yet certain nights were not available in the restore process. And I'm not talking about the oldest ones, i'm talking about the  second newest restore point in one case. It was all over the board. Then i noticed it would not go above 12 restore points, which is ok but i used VSSADMIN list ShadowStorage at the command line as administrator and, for example, my C: volume was building  in size every night but restore points were dropping off. I was not even close to the MAX amount of disc for shadow storage.   THEN, this morning i discovered that system restore ran ok at 1:30:00am as usual and got "task completed" and "action completed" both at 1:30:07am:, but then9 minutes later at 1:39:34 there is another entry:Task Engine received message to start task. event  319(Same entry it has at 1:30:00 every night) then the next entry in history is event 101, Task Start Failed. And that is the last entry to this point in time. I have no idea what sent it a message to start at 1:39:34 after it had just finished successfully.  The result or error code it got when it errored at "Task Start Failed" was2147750689.   After seeing this (I've been monitoring both SystemRestore and defrag after changing them to run in the a.m. by "waking the computer") i went to system properties, system protection and it showed for all 3 volumes the last restore point was the one from  yesterday 1/18 at 1:30:00, even though technically it finished just fine on 1/19 but triggered again for some strange reason. I then went to sysetm restore, choose restore point, clicked next (like i always do to see all restore points) and there was only  TWO restore points available. The two most current for 1/18 and 1/17. That was it. The "see more than 5" check box was not there. They were the ONLY TWO.  And right now the task is sitting at "Ready" for status but the "Last run result is "The task is currently running (0x41301). Strange indeed considering the status is "Ready".  And also because the last entry as noted was failed with event code code above. does that make any sense?   THEN, I used VSSADMIN list shadowstorage and it is showing more growth since YESTERDAY on all 3 volumes??? The C: volume has about 15GB of USED disc space showing there, with a MAX of 20GB. How could i be losing restore points like this?Yet the disc  showing that the space is used and keeps climbing every night? These are just the most recent and bizarre occurances. I've had it reduce to 3 restore points one other time earlier on after I had started it running nightly by "waking the computer" when there had been 6 or 7. What is happening to my restore points and  why is the task scheduler acting freaky? Same with Defrag. Yesterday i manually defragged the machine cause it had failed the time before. It kicked off at 2:45am and when it's successful it only takes around 45 minutest at most to run. I'm not deleting and adding new files all of the time.  My usage is very consistent. last night it kicked off but as it does sometimes, never finished in the time between 2:45am and the time I logged on. Usually i don't logon again until the next evening, then there are entries for the time i logged in, in the  task scheduler history entries. I refresh them every time i look at them too. Well since i manually defragged last night, and i changed the manual task from defrag.exe -c to defrag.exe -c -w so it would defrag every fragment. Otherwise the default is  only fragments smaller than 64 MB. Maybe that is what I should always do? HELP on that one please.  But considering it was just run, this morning task scheduler showed it kicked off and action started just fine at 2:45am but had not finished. Huh? I just totally defraged all volumes last night and didn't use the machine after that. (the -c switch is to  defrag all volumes by the way, so the setting for manual defrag was to do all volumes with default defragging before i added the -w in to totally defrag all volumes. I changed it back. ) But anyway, when I logged onto the machine this morning the defrag  finished. I hace a feeling something happened after the task woke the machine and it started at 2:45. I don't know what, but it was stalled until I logged on cause it's set to finish at the next available time like most all tasks.It was set to finish only  when the machine was idle but uncheckec that cause it was never finishing in the past. It would error out instead before it ever finished, at least most of the time.It is set to try for like 3 days or run that long before it's stopped, but i think the day  to day runs were bumping into each other cause it never finished, at least not timely and that somehow was killing it.  Anyway, I don't know why it won't finish when the drives were completely defragged. It does work the way i have it setup for waking the machine at 2:45 and has successfully finished in under an hour. (I had to defrag all volumes manually back when i set  it up for this nightly run so it was caught up and could finish. I let it run weekly but set it for 4 out of the 7 days so ti should finish easily but does only sometimes. Others it does when i logon the next time or it still fails sometimes. These tasks  are so fragile and messed up. Sorry for being so very very wordy on this. I tried to explain and i'm sure i repeated myself.   The systemrestore points disappearing are what is troubling me the most. I relied on that a lot on my XP machine and it worked flawlessly. I'm thinking i should not have all volumes turned on. My D: drive is the second internal drive and right now i only  store downloads and installation files on it, so if I ever have to wipe Vista and reload it, most of my software is on that drive to start the process of resinstalling my software. The F: volume is a large 500GB external (it only has 100GB used on it and  it's restore file is very small) and it has my photos and music and stuff like that. I don't think i need to have restore points on those drives. Any advice? You see, sometimes I'll install a program but make the F: drive the data drive for the program.  Still not sure i need restore points on it. Someday i might start installing programs on the d: drive when i run out of space on c:, but until then.........what do you think? XP used to take away files that weren't there at teh restore point, and I lliked  that in som cases and likewise it would bring back files that were deleted before i ran the restore. Now files are untouched I believe....those that aren't system files I mean of course.   Please help me. I have my sleep set for 2 hours, so after the machine is woken to run these jobs, it has 2 hours before the machine goes to sleep again and i'm not sure it does if they are running. I believe it would since it goes by user input?? But 2  hours is plenty of time for these to finish. Esp. the restore points. thanks SO much, Jerry
test1.title: Problems with SystemRestore and defrag using Task Scheduler

According to TLSReports, the website is SSLv3-only (No SSLv2 nor TLSv1). However, when I enable SSLv2 or disable TLSv1 through the Advanced settings, the site loads correctly. test1.content: I'm using Windows Vista Ultimate SP1 on a 64-bit Intel Quad system. I need to turn on the Microsoft Message Queue (MSMQ) Server and Server Corefeatures in Windows Programs and Features, but the requested action does not complete. Rather, after 45-60  minutes, I get an error message stating, "An error has occurred. Not all the features were successfully changed." In reality, no features were either turned on or turned off. THen searching the various MS forums, the only reference I can find for a fix is  at:Windows Vista SP1 Minidump Settings not Saved > Windows Update > Windows Vista> Microsoft Answers Forums, in which the following post suggests a solution, but for me, does not work (see bottom for results I get):  "Keith-Support EngineerMSFT, Moderator - Posted on Thursday, December 18, 2008 1:02:58 PM    Have you noticed similar error messages when checking other dependencies tabs on different services or is this only on the Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) service? Are you able to access the Turn Windows features on or off option in Programs and Features?  Click the Pearl (start) button on your desktop Click Control Panel Select Programs and Features (This is Classic View) Once Programs and Features is open, on the left side under Tasks, select Turn Windows features on or off  Does Turn Windows features on or off open for you or do you receive an error? (It might take a few moments to open.) If you are not comfortable doing the below steps, you can create a system restore point before proceeding. Please see the following Microsoft Article about System Restore: http://support.microsoft.com/kb/322756  The below command will Re-register the WMI components. cd /d %windir%\system32\wbem for %i in (*.dll) do RegSvr32 -s %i  Click the Pearl (start) button on your desktop In the Search field type cmd (do not hit enter) cmd.exe will now be in the Start Menu, right-click cmd.exe and select Run as administrator (If you recieve the User Account Control prompt, click allow or continue to proceed)   Copy and Paste cd /d %windir%\system32\wbem in the Command Prompt and hit enter   Copy and Pastefor %i in (*.dll) do RegSvr32 -s %i in the Command Prompt and hit enter   After this has completed, close the Command Prompt and check to see if the problem is still there.  If the problem is still there, please copy the below text into notepad and save the file as repair.bat and then double click to run, it should not take but a few moments to run. This will attempt to repair WMI. @echo off sc config winmgmt start= disabled net stop winmgmt /y %systemdrive% cd %windir%\system32\wbem if exist repository.old rmdir /s/q repository.old rename repository repository.old for /f %%s in ('dir /b *.dll') do regsvr32 /s %%s for /f %s in ('dir /b *.mof *.mfl') do mofcomp %s wmiprvse /regserver winmgmt /regserver net start winmgmt net start SharedAccess net start CcmExec I have followed Keiths suggestions to the letter, but without solving the problem. When applying Keith's final suggestion, I get a message stating "Access is denied - error 5 has occurred" Please help me to resolve this issue.
test1.title: Cannot turn any Windows Features on or off in Programs & Features

test1.content: Subject: Windows Live OneCare Topic: Link to local network drive.  WLOC (Windows Live OneCare) link setup was used to establish the link and connection to the network drive and folder for the backup path. Everything functions fine for about five days then the security firewall blocks the connection. The drive link appears in My Network Places. I click on it and get Access Denied etc. I established that it is Windows security blocking access by turning OFF the WLOC security system; clicking on the network places link and get immediate access; run the backup. It worked. Then I turned the WLOC firewall back on. For the next four days it works with the WLOC firewall on. Then we repeat the process. I've found I can turn the WLOC firewall back on as soon as I have reestablished the link; without waiting for the backup to start.  My only security is Windows built in and WLOC. My OS is XP Home but Vista is the only forum, so here I am. Computers, LAN and the network drive are all on UPS so power fluxations and interruptions are a non-problem. This situation occursfor each of thethree computerson different days, virtually eliminating the LAN or Drive as the problem. I have no idea how to start on the fix to this problem. Suggestiona? Gerry Eberwein

test1.content: I posted this on the ASP.Net Forums without getting a reply. I was hoping that someone here could help.  I am working on an ASP.Net / C# web application. It currently runs on a remote server, and I have been testing it online. (I am a tester who also does HTML/CSS/JavaScript. I have done a little bit of programming in the past.) Recently, we tried putting the app on my laptop computer.  My laptop is running Vista Home Premium 32-bit. I have 2005 Visual Studio and SQL Server. I have the .Net Framework turned on.  The problem is that, when I try to run the app on my computer, I am getting an error about the ASP.Net Session State. Part of the erroris listed below at the end of this message. My manager had me look in my Control Panel/Admin/Services to turn on ASP.Net  Session Service. But, it was not listed on the Services list. This may be a rather simple question, but: Why don't I have this Service? Does it have something to do with running 32-bit? (This is the main reason for me posting this.I would like to find out what is going on here. I like to learn about what is going on and why I don't have this service.)  My manager had me comment out a smallsection of code in the Web Config file of the web app that referred to the State Service, and I am now able to run the app.  I would appreciate any help. I have checked the MSDN site and others, but because I don't have much programming experience, there is a lot that I don't understand there. I would liketo know why I don't have this service.  Here is the first part of my error message I get when I try to run/debug on my laptop: Unable to make the session state request to the session state server. Please ensure that the ASP.NET State service is started and that the client and server ports are the same. If the server is on a remote machine, please  ensure that it accepts remote requests by checking the value of HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\aspnet_state\Parameters\AllowRemoteConnection. If the server is on the local machine, and if the before mentioned registry value does not  exist or is set to 0, then the state server connection string must use either 'localhost' or '127.0.0.1' as the server name.
test1.title: asp.net State Service

test1.content: Im having all kinds of grief with Outlook 2007 hanging up. This problem comes and goes randomly. I wonder if you might have any ideas?   Here's my configuration:  I connect to an Exchange server via VPN (RAS). I use a local PST as the default store. In addition to my Exchange account, I also have another "additional mailbox" open (it's a shared mailbox on the Exchange server). I have a very fast connection - about 15-20 MBps I'm running Windows XP SP3. I know - it's a complex configuration, but most of the time, Outlook is very fast - so I know it can and does work well.   What I can't figure out is that sometimes, a problem occurs in which Outlook hangs, or just takes a long time to respond when I click any message or folder. It's like someone throws a switch that causes a very different performance behavior. Its as though  Outlook forgets my credentials and needs to keep checking with the Exchange server for every action.   When the problem happens, if I click Cancel Server Request, Outlook is fine for about 10 seconds, and then it slows down again. If I click Work Offline on the File menu in Outlook, Outlook runs fine. If I try to run Outlook in Online mode again, it starts  hanging again. This problem occurs if I am Rasd in or if Im working offline using RDP over Http.   Other times, most of the time, Outlook is fine its very fast. It runs great, and then bam for no apparent reason, it starts hanging again. When the problem happens, it can last a day or two or only just a few hours. Its a major pain though.   Heres what Ive tried none of these have resolved the problem: Change the VPN Disable all add-ons Run Outlook /safe Run Outlook /cleanrules Run outlook /cleanprofile Delete everything here: C:\Documents and Settings\v-dgit\Local Settings\Application Data\Microsoft\Outlook Built a new profile Run PST repair tool on the PST Detect and Repair on Office Uninstall/Re-install Office  Nothing resolves the problem. The problem is there, and then suddenly, for no apparent reason, Outlook starts working properly again. Then a day later, it happens again.   The only thing that seems to affect the problem (when it happens) is to click Cancel Server Request, or click Work Offline on the File menu in Outlook.  This suggests that its directly related to Outlook trying to communicate something to or from the Exchange server.  Could it be an issue with my corp user account being corrupted? Maybe Outlook is trying to verify my credentials?  Why would this problem stop and then start again for no apparent reason? Im considering flattening the box, but that seems extreme for an issue that seems suspiciously as though it is server related.   Any ideas you may have would sure be appreciated!!!  Darryl Gittins

test1.content: Hi Rami I too have a permissions problem. In my case it is preventing internet explorer from showing .swf files. Shockwave Flash Player is already installed, but it acts as if it isn't. If I re-install it it makes no difference.  Anyway, long story short, I came across your info (below) as I wanted to try the inbuilt admin account to see if I got the same problem.   When I tried method 1, I didn't have "Local Users and Groups" in the "Computer Management Console".  When I try Method 2, I just get permission denied. When I right click the "run" icon I do not get a "Run as administrator" option (because I am using an admin account I guess).   I have also tried "subinacl" and it says that SeSecurityPrivilege is not set. The actual message is below:   C:\Program Files\Windows Resource Kits\Tools>subinacl /samobject *users* /display  SeSecurityPrivilege : Access is denied. WARNING :Unable to set SeSecurityPrivilege privilege. This privilege may be required.   Is there any way I can check my privileges (i.e. is there a cmd tool that will allow me to see "Local Users and Groups").  Any other ideas would be most welcome. Regards Richard How to activate the Administrator Account Method 1: Through User Account Control 1. Go to your Start menu and right-click on the My Computer icon. 2. Choosing Manage from the list will prompt a User Account Control (UAC). 3. When you are done, the Computer Management console will appear. Expand the Local Users and Groups option with the use of the arrow next to it and choose Users folder.  4. You can now select the Administrator Account and go to the Actions panel to open More Actions.  5. Choose Properties to open the Administrator Properties dialog box and uncheck the option labeled Account is Disabled.  6. When done, click OK to confirm changes. 7. The Administrator account should now be present on your log in screen. Method 2: With Command Prompt 1. Go to your Start menu and in Accessories list, open Command Prompt by right-clicking on its icon and choosing Run as Administrator  2. When the Command Prompt window appears, enter the command net user administrator /active:yes  3. When done, log out from your current account. 4. The Administrator account should now be present on your log in screen.
test1.title: Shockwave Flash Player is already installed, but it acts as if it isn't.

test1.content: My DSL is through Qwest, so Iuse MSN premium software (latest version 9.6 something), which is included in the fee. I have beenusing it forabout 5 years. I really like the program and wish to continue using it.  I recently bought a new computer (Dell XPS in December 08) with Vista x64 premium. I have had various issues with MSN mail, since using Vista, that I did not have with XP. The rest of the premium package such as MSN explorer has worked very well on Vista.  What are the known issues and work arounds with MSNmail and Vista x64?  I have found very little information on it. I have read various forum posts, but most don't offer any real helpful solutions. MSN mail support seems to be lacking. Calling Qwest gets me a technician who recommends I switch to Windows Live mail. Qwest seems  to think MSN mail is not compatible with Vista, but one of the postsI read from a Microsoft Engineer assures everyone that Vista is compatible with MSN mail and works fine.  Here are some of my issues: 1. MSN mail reacting very slow when I select an action, such as opening an email or deleting it. It was extremely fast for a while after I first installed it, but more and more it is getting sluggish and slow.  2. More and more I am getting "MSN has stopped working and needs to be shut down." Which is very irritating when it shows up right after I hit send after typing a long email response.  3. Currently if I try to use photo sharing email it shuts the MSN program down.  4. In the MSN mail program, I have it set upfor 4 different email accounts.They are all MSN or hotmail accounts that I have been using for years. When I am having problems with one of them (such as the connection to the server is lost, yellow icon) I select  one ofthe other accounts and they are fine. I also use IE to go to the email site directly and that works fine.I have fixed thismore than once by removing the account from MSN mail, restarting the MSN program and adding the account back in again. That  is a real pain to have to do over and over. 5. IsMSN premium going to continue using MSN mail or switch to Live mail? As far as I can tell Live mail has all the support and MSN has next to none.  Needless to say this is very frusterating. I am contemplating removing Vista from my system and installing XP premium, I did not have any of these problems when I was using that operating system.  Does anyone out thereknow any of these answers? Can you point me to a knowledge base or website, etc that has information on these issues? Is there an MSN knowledgable contact you might refer me to?  I believe this is more of a Vista problem than an MSN problem (since I didn't have these problems with XP), which is why I may end up removing Vista from my machine.  I will appreciate any helpful replies. Thanks, Frank Fleming
test1.title: MSN Mail and Vista compatibility

test1.content: In Windows Media Center, I can only access the digital signal from my TV Tuner. I need to access the analog signal to watch TV from my DirecTV box. I have gotten this to work using the software provided with my TV tuner, but I would prefer to use the media  center.  This is what it says on the help page in Windows, but my Media Center does not say anything about an analog signal and I've tried EVERYTHING.   Often, a TV signal from a cable box (sometimes referred to as a set-top box) or satellite receiver can include channels that are either standard or high definition. If you want to use two tuners in Windows Media Center you must have two cable boxes or two satellite receivers. Each tuner requires its own TV signal input.   Connect the cable from the cable source (wall jack) to the cable input jack on the cable box or satellite receiver. If you have two cable boxes or two satellite receivers that you want to use with Windows Media Center, you can use a splitter to divide the TV signal from the wall jack to the boxes. Each cable box or satellite receiver must have a TV signal connected to the cable input jack.  Connect a cable from the cable output jack on the cable box or satellite receiver to the WindowsWindows Media Center computer. Media Center computer. Make sure the cable is connected to the TV IN jack on the appropriate tuner hardware in the  If you have two tuners, make sure each tuner has its own TV signal connected to the TV IN jack.  On the start screen, scroll to Tasks, click settings, click TV, and then click Set Up TV Signal.  Follow the steps to connect a TV signal, depending on the type of tuner or tuners that the cable is connected to, as well as the type of programming to which you subscribe.
test1.title: I can't configure my Windows Media Center to pick up analog signal from TV Tuner.

I think most of the data on them are some sort of word processing file - I could have sworn I had MS Word on my Mac back then, but maybe not.  I have a USB 3.5" drive, and with MacDrive software I can browse the disks on Vista. All that works fine. Where the process breaks down is in the file formats.  There are two in particular - one is called "Floyd.959592A.FULL" and the Type is "FULL File"; the corresponding file is "Floyd.950502A #001" and the Type is "File." I'm assuming that these two are the data fork and the resource fork for the one Mac file. (There's  another set, which is "Floyd.950502B.FULL" and "Floyd.950502B #001")  Does anyone know what these file extensions are from? And how do I convert them into Word? When I try opening in Word 2007 it's still a mishmash of $###*&^%@*@&% type characters, with some smattering of actual English words in there - so I can tell these used  to be word processing docs at some stage.  Are these four files actually some sort of backup? Anyone know how I could proceed?  Thanks.

test1.content: Hey guys,  I have recently started to develop a SharePoint Online website to allow internal network members to communicate and update information between each other. I have a set of goals that I need to fulfill for this project, however; I am still in the design phase  of the site structure and was thinking of designing the site in a number of ways. However, because I am newer to the SharePoint world, I am on here to inquire about what people have found optimal for designing their site. Before I ask you all, I want to tell  you what I am trying to do:  I want to have a main site for all internal network members, but I want to give different departments their own individual area to communicate. These individual areas should be able to also interact with external tasks and lists (or anything else required by  their work). So basically, I want to have separated areas on the website which are specifically made for departments within the network; but also allow them to cross-interact.   My two current ideas of this so far are: Idea #1: Design the SharePoint Team Site so that there are separate pages for separate departments. Each department page will have their own unique document sharing areas and collaboration  features. Different departments should be able to cross-reference and communicate when needed.  Idea #2: Design the SharePoint Team Site, so that there are separate subsites for separate departments. Each Subsite will only be accessible to the department associated with the subsite;  and only department members of related site may have access. Upon this design, each subsite can communicate with other subsites.  With that all being said, I was wondering if anyone with extensive SharePoint experience has any opinions on those ideas; and what they may find more optimal. Any opinions are highly welcome. I was leaning towards Idea #2, because it gives each department its  own clean area that doesn't mix in with other departments, but the feasibility of it seems questionable.
test1.title: SharePoint Online Site Layout Ideas

test1.content: Hello, I have been experiencing some problems with dragging and dropping files from a SharePoint document library to either Outlook or a folder on the client computer. This has been observed on multiple computers with different logins and on two different tenants. The problem in details: When a user use an internet browser to browse to a document library and want to drag a file from the browser to either an Outlook e-mail composing window or a local folder on the pc, a shortcut is created insted of attaching the file tothe e-mail or downloading  it the folder on the PC. Attaching/downloading does work some times, but far from always. I haven't figured a pattern on when it works or when it don't. From another post on the same topic, I have gathered the following informations: Browsers checked with: IE 11, Chrome and Firefox, all updates installed. Operating systems checked with: Windows 7 and 10, all updates installed. Windows 10 also with build 14295. Office packs checked with: Office 2013 and 2016, all updates installed. License used: E3 Filetypes tested with: .docx, .pdf, .pdf PCs tested with: 4 Tenants tested with: 2 Have tried adding the two tenants to the Internet Explorer trusted zone - even tried *.SharePoint.com Have tried clearing the cache of the browsers (IE,Chrome and Firefox) Checked that SharePoint DragDownload Control and SharePoint OpenDocuments Class are enabled. But as I understand it, they  are not needed for this to work in IE 10 and 11? Have tried, while dragging a file to a e-mail composer window, to "drop" it on different parts of the window: The body, the narrow space between the body and subject line, on To and CC fields and above the To field. Some times it will work, but only with  dragging the file to the space between the body and subject line. Have tried dragging the file, using the text/title of the file in the document library and also using the icon of the file. When using the icon, some times the mouse pointer icon change into what looks like a copy-icon (the little plus-sign), but when dropping  the file to an e-mail or a folder, does nothing. Please tell me if I should provide you with more info or other tests. Best regards Anders
test1.title: Drag and Download does not work from SharePoint to Outlook or folder

test1.content: I am at the end of my rope with OneDrive for Business. Never have I been more confused about a product. I have spent hours reading forum posts and blog posts about the three different versions of OneDrive (which are, for some reason, all called OneDrive).  I am going to give this one last shot before settling for our old way - file sharing with Google Drive. First, here's why I WANT to make this work: - I'd like our organization to be invested in one ecosystem for seamless integration. I love the idea of employees being able to move from workstation to workstation and have access to their own files (via file explorer). - I have this partially working, and can see some really useful features, such as opening Word and seeing my recent files, even if it was on another computer. - The ultimate goal is to have our shared files stored in one central location that all employees have access to, with different permission levels. Previously, with Google Drive, our shared files were owned by individuals and there was no control and the  organizational level. Office 365 was intended to be our solution to this. Here is our environment: - We started with a new install of Office 2016. Understanding that I need the 2013 version of One Drive for Business (groove.exe), I uninstalled 2016, installed 2013. Then reinstalled 2016. I *think* One Drive for Business (groove.exe) is installed  on both computers I am currently working on. If I type "groove.exe" into Cortana, One Drive for Business appears, whereas it didn't before the uninstall/reinstall dance. - On my machine - my user account only - I have been able to get it to work beautifully. I logged into the site, used the "sync" button, and it synced with my computer locally. So far, the sync works beautifully. In file explorer, under the two One Drive  options, there is a SharePoint access to the team site and files. They are all available through the Office apps, too. It is fantastic.  - Since it is working in one spot, I tried to set it up with a different user account on the same computer. Following the same steps, I try the sync button, it asks me for credentials, then when I click "next" nothing happens. Nothing even tries to happen.  It is like I am clicking on a dead button. - I tried to get it going on my user account on a different computer, and the same thing happens. The browser launches groove.exe, OneDrive box appears, it asks me for credentials, and then nothing happens. The same dead next button that goes nowhere. Can you help me make it work? Obviously I got it going once, so I should be able to do it again, right? Apparently not. How do I make it work? I am willing to uninstall everything and start from scratch. Our staff has been without a reliable file structure for days, and I've got to get  this working for them. I have been relying on blog posts and self-service help, which I am usually happy to do, but almost every page I am finding seems to have out of date instructions or references "OneDrive" without specifying if it is groove.exe or onedrive.exe or an older  version. I just don't know what to do. Sidenote: I tried to bypass all of this and map a network drive, but the instructions for that didn't work, either.  Another sidenote, if you cannot tell, I am NOT an IT professional. Just a many-hats small business manager who sees a lot of opportunity with this tool and really wants to make it work. Can anyone provideme with step-by-step instructions on how to locally view files located on a Site?  Thanks in advance, Katharine
test1.title: Help me configure One Drive for Business and SharePoint Site Files?

test1.content: Hi There, As a way of background, we are looking at the potential of replacing our traditional file servers with SharePoint online (out of the box document libraries). However, we are currently trying to figure out the best approach in terms of users interaction with SharePoint Online and how they would go about accessing their files one a day-to-day basis. 1. Do we leave the data on the site and simply provide users with a simple URL so they only have browser access? 2. In addition to the URL do we provide the OneDrive sync client for local access? 3. Do we add the Sharepoint sites directly into office applications? All the above have their pro's and con's. Leaving users to just access information online will certainly alienate many who are accustomed to using file explorer, whereas the one drive sync client throws its own set of challenges; Sync issues , Versioning.  local disk space? Feeding urls into office programs certainly sounds smart in theory however, would this be over complicating it from and end users perspective? Clearly whichever option(s) we take up users will need to adjust to a new way of working, however, we don't want to discourage users and see the need to provide some familiarity. Im looking out people/companies out there who have faced similar challenges and methods they've settled for and why? Thanks for reading and any advise will be hugely appreciated, K.
test1.title: User Interaction with Sharepoint online

test1.content: Hi,  My client has 15Tb of a bog standard SharePoint 2010 farm mostly in hierarchical document libraries across about 12 Web Applications.  They intend to purchase 1000 Office 365 E3 licenses (which include SharePoint Online). This only gives them 1TB+ 0.5Gb per user = 1.5Tbin SharePoint. (This is only 10% of the space required.)  Each web application in SP2010 has its own domain name or host header. This provides a degree of separation across the business that it would be desirable to maintain, if only to maintain the same navigation and links across the various web applications.  Rather than put all the web applications as (their own) site collections under the root SharePoint Online site collection, is it possible to have a separate tenancy for each web application, with an extra tenancy to centralise ADFS for the 1000 users and  their access to the other tenancies ? The idea is replicate the web application concept in SharePoint Online which only has site collections. Each tenancy's root site collection would be analogous to a SharePoint 2010 federated site.

test1.content: Our Office365 Enterprise E1 Tenant is still running Sharepoint 2013. We have not been upgraded yet.  This is is what I'm seeing for our Office365 Sharepoint 2013... I'm wondering if any of this changes for Sharepoint 2016 as it has unique file IDs and hopefully better preservation of metadata during moves/copies....  I note that Windows Explorer copies show metadata preserved after copy, but Sharepoint doesn't access/reflect it.  Observed behavior:  When I sync external nested folders/files (upload) to a Sharepoint library using ONE DRIVE FOR BUSINESS (recommended by MS for LARGE data import)... modified dates for FILES are preserved. modified dates for Folders are not preserved and are set to the date/time imported into Sharepoint.  When I upload / download files using the browser drag/drop copy...   modified dates for files are lost and set to the import date (you can't drag/drop folders via browser)  When I move/copy files and nested folder/files using the OPEN WITH EXPLORER option:  modified dates for files and folders are lost and set to the import date This includes opening an Open With Explorer window for two Sharepoint document libraries and copying between. NOTE that the Explorer window still shows the proper modified dates for both files and folders, even after copying to the new Explorer Window... but Sharepoint can't access or show those dates.  When I copy single files between Document Libraries using the COPY function (in which you must type a carefully crafted URL for the destination library... the built-in sharepoint library select option won't be available till 2016 is enabled)...   modified dates for files and folders are lost and set to the import date  So the overreaching question is will Sharepoint 2016 behave differently and handle preservation of metadata properly? The fact that in even the best situation, folder dates are reset to the copy/move/import date means one always has to open folders  to the file level to see what their dates are. In most cases all dates are lost (even though Windows Explorer still continues to see those dates).  Thanks, Tony
test1.title: Perserving date/owner metadata when copying/moving in Office365 Sharepoint - 2013 vs 2016

test1.content: Please excuse my inexperience but I have been trying to narrow down a question regarding sharing a UnifiedGroup, in particular the OneNote Notebook, with external users with a Microsoft account and UserType:Guest.  Some of the background is in these two threads: Add external user with Microsoft Account to UnifiedGroup?; and Office 365 OneNote App access by external user with Microsoft Account?.  I'm satisfied that I can share a Notebook with these external users if I follow these steps:   Share an Office 365 | SharePoint site using Share your site => Invite people and entering an email address. This appears to accept any email address and sends an invitation to it. If the email address doesn't have an associated Microsoft account then the user is prompted to create one. Hopefully, it  would also do something sensible for a Work or school account in another tenant.User accepts the invitation and is granted access to the SharePoint site. After some delay the user is visible to Get-MsolUser and has UserType:Guest; CloudExchangeRecipientDisplayType:6; UserPrincipalName:*** Email address is removed for privacy ***.Now that the external guest user is visible in the directory it can be added as a member of the UnifiedGroup and they receive an email informing them of their membership: Subject: Some Body added you to the Some Group group.They can then browse to https://contoso.sharepoint.com/sites/somegroup to find the shared documents, click the three-bar box in the top left corner and select Notebook.They won't be able to find the Notebook in the OneNote App (Microsoft account doesn't know the tenants where it is a guest user?). Is there a simpler way that avoids the need to share an Office 365 | SharePoint site and would allow invitations to be issued directly for the UnifiedGroup?  Is it supposed to work this way? Or am I exploiting an unanticipated feature/bug?  I'm prepared to try to use PowerShell, Microsoft Graph or other technologies if it will make it easier for the external users to get connected.
test1.title: Sharing a UnifiedGroup with an external guest user?

test1.content: Hi All,  We need to be able to share folders with people external to the company and my manager wants me to customise the sharing email sent to the external person. I am trying to do this via workflows with calls to the REST API.  For some backgroud here is the full requirement :  Within our organisation we have 12 site collections, one for each team. External sharing has been disabled on all but one site collection. Users within the organisation should be able to raise an external sharing request on their team site. I have done this  with a workflow and a custom action within their document library.  When the workflow is invoked it will capture the name of the external party and their email address using the initiation form parameters on the workflow. On the site collection I've setup for external sharing I have also setup a document library for each team. Inside the teams document library I want to create a folder corresponding to the external party name. This parts works fine by calling the REST API  via a web service and creating a folder.  Next I break permissions on the folder, this work fine too again calling REST API via web services in the workflow.  Next I need to be able to assign permissions to the external party via REST API too. According to this link https://dev.office.com/patterns-and-practices-detail/1870 this ability is available via rest  https://OurSPSiteName/sites/ExternalSharing/_api/Web/ShareDocument('https://urSPSiteName/sites/ExternalSharing/IT/Sunday3',*** Email address is removed for privacy ***',ExternalSharingDocumentOption.View,true, 'Here's your important document');  However this part is not working and there very little documentation on the subject. Any ideas?  Thanks Paul
test1.title: External Sharing Rest API

test1.content: I have multiple SharePoint sites, some sub sites, some separate., all hosted on 365 online (corporate account)  Until last Friday everything worked fine. Today I go into one of the sites, and it cashes IE11 with the "A problem caused the program to stop working correctly. Windows will close the program and notify youif a solution is available." <Debug> <Close Program>. Close program re-launches the page  load attempt, the error repeats, and eventually - a quick press on <Cancel> allows me to get to the grab below. I have fixed this on several sites, by going straight to "Settings" - pasting #/_layouts/15/settings.aspx into the URL, then rolling back "home.aspx" to its earliest versions (slightly annoying).  One thin common on all the rollbacks, is if I can get to prior to a "Wiki" addition, the page works, on sites where the "Wiki" was present from scratch, I am presumably going to have to edit home.aspx / community.aspx, / about.aspx etc (all the pages use  the Wiki it seems). Has something just occurred to alter the "Wiki" feature of SharePoint sites? Most of the impacted pages haven't been edited for weeks, even months! <update, the error debugged in VS gives: "Unhandled exception at 0x6FE9468B (ucrtbase.dll) in iexplore.exe: Fatal program exit requested."> And the next step of debug gives some sort of missing: <"ucrtbase.pdb">     We were unable to return you to sharepoint.com. Internet Explorer has stopped trying to restore this website. It appears that the website is continuing to have a problem.    What you can do: Go to your home page Try to return to sharepoint.com             More information When a website causes a failure or crash, Internet Explorer attempts to restore the site. It stops after two tries to avoid an endless loop.       <update> This fault does not occur in Edge, Chrome or Mozilla. So is associated to IE 11? Perhaps KB3160005? https://support.microsoft.com/en-gb/kb/3160005 </update>
test1.title: home.aspx crashing IE 11 on multiple sites, "Wiki" implied? Sharepoint update (perhaps this weekend - 25th - 27th June 2016)

test1.content: Hi, We created SharePoint site (Windows Authentication). We developed mobile app and tried to connect to the site by using Rest API that already created by MS SharePoint. We created the below functions to authenticate mobile app requests and  it's working well but we face a problem because Rest API requested authentication each time we make a request so we resolved this issue by calling these functions many times. The final result is performance is bad. Note: We use ntlm.js library  I need to authenticate once.  JavaScriptFunctions: Ntlm.setCredentials = function (domain, username, password) {  var magic = 'KGS!@#$%'; // Create LM password hash.  var lmPassword = password.toUpperCase().substr(0, 14);  while (lmPassword.length < 14) lmPassword += '\0';  var key1 = Ntlm.createKey(lmPassword);  var key2 = Ntlm.createKey(lmPassword.substr(7));  var lmHashedPassword = des(key1, magic, 1, 0) + des(key2, magic, 1, 0);   var ntPassword = ''; // Create NT password hash.  for (var i = 0; i < password.length; i++)  ntPassword += password.charAt(i) + '\0';  var ntHashedPassword = str_md4(ntPassword);   Ntlm.domain = domain;  Ntlm.username = username;  Ntlm.lmHashedPassword = lmHashedPassword;  Ntlm.ntHashedPassword = ntHashedPassword; }; Ntlm.authenticate = function (url, Method) {  if (!Ntlm.domain || !Ntlm.username || !Ntlm.lmHashedPassword || !Ntlm.ntHashedPassword) {  Ntlm.error('No NTLM credentials specified. Use Ntlm.setCredentials(...) before making calls.');  return false;  }  var hostname = Ntlm.getLocation(url).hostname;  var msg1 = Ntlm.createMessage1(hostname);  var request = new XMLHttpRequest();  request.open(Method, url, false);  request.setRequestHeader('Authorization', 'NTLM ' + msg1.toBase64());  request.overrideMimeType('text/xml; charset=UTF-8');  request.send();  var response = request.getResponseHeader('WWW-Authenticate');  var challenge = Ntlm.getChallenge(response);   var msg3 = Ntlm.createMessage3(challenge, hostname);  request.open(Method, url, false);  request.overrideMimeType('text/xml; charset=UTF-8');  request.setRequestHeader('Authorization', 'NTLM ' + msg3.toBase64());  request.send();  return request.status == 200; }; Regards, Khaled Abed
test1.title: SharePoint 2013 Rest API Authentication Problem

test1.content: Hello everyone, I am not sure how willing people may be to talk about making custom workflows in SharePoint Designer 2013, but I thought I would ask about this. Right now, I am making a prototype Workflow which will allow members to get assigned to a task, then when that task is done; it will go to a manager for approval. I have been able to model  this intention very accurately; with the only exception being: I can't figure out how to make the Workflow dynamic with end users. I will explain:  The basics of my custom workflow are as follows: Underlined text is where I need help on.  Stage 1 - Workflow Initiation > List item is created, workflow is added to this list item. > List item is assigned to a specific user (Any user chosen by manager.) > End user in receives an email detailing that there is a task assigned to them. > End user responds to workflow and modifies the comments. > List item gets moved to pending status. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- > Management rejects the change, and resets the list item into stage 1 OR > Management approves the change, and allows the list item to move to stage 2.  Stage 2 - Workflow Active > Active workflow waits for changes by assigned user. > If approved, the priority is set to low and a list item is made in a external list for logging. List item gets moved to completed status. > If approved, end of workflow. > If rejected, stage 2 resets until manager is satisfied with result.  I want to be able to make it so that a specific user isn't required for the action where you select "send an email", since that should be determined by the workflow initiator (The one who created the list and added the user manually in SharePoint).  It seems like when I am designing my workflow however, I need to select a specific user and can't leave it as a variable that will reflect the assigned user. IS there a way to make that happen so the Workflow is dynamic and not specific for a single end-user?  Manually editing the workflow for each user would be tedious and impractical. Everything else is working, I just want my workflow to be less specific to a user and more for anyone who needs to be assigned to a task.  Anyone who really wants to provide input to this feel free to reply in here. I am learning as I go and I have it down pretty good; just some minor nooks and crannies. Also, does anyone know a great site or literature that documents the SharePoint Designer  or making Workflows? I would like some reinforcement on my self-learning via literature.
test1.title: Workflows and SharePoint Designer 2013.

test1.content: I have been trying to create DLP policies around custom content types and their meta data and have been running in to issues. So for the background we have been trying to implement DLP policies by using custom properties versus the pre-built properties that  O365 is already aware of. I've been following the directions from here:  https://support.office.com/en-us/article/Create-a-DLP-policy-to-protect-documents-with-FCI-or-other-properties-1b9e3c6c-4308-4a20-b11e-c37b8013e177?ui=en-US&rs=en-US&ad=US&fromAR=1  I can create the custom content type, with columns to manage the meta data. I can see the columns in the Crawled Properties, and I can map those to a managed property. When I create the DLP policy off of the managed property it is triggering an alert regardless  of what the properties content. For example I create a custom content type called "Business File", and that content type has a column associated with it called "Business Risk" which has three levels: Low, Medium, High, with a default of Medium. When I create  a new managed property I can see the crawled property of "Business Risk" which I map to a managed property of BRISK. When I create the DLP property, I select custom property of BRISK with a value of "HIGH" and block and alert. When I go back to that library  and select New, Business File, it creates the new file, defaults to "Medium" on the Business Risk column, which I change to "Low". It usually takes about 30 minutes, but then the file will be blocked, regardless of what is in the Business Risk column. If I  upload a file and select as type Business File, it will default to "Medium" but DLP will not trigger off of those files, even if I set to "High".   Anyone have luck creating custom DLP in SPOL using managed properties?
test1.title: DLP - Custom Content Type

test1.content: Hello all. I am attempting to share foldersI have created on my organisations team site with a number of external users who are also using O365. When i go to the specific folder i wish to share with the user(s) I click the elipsys and choose share. When  then entering the email address of the person(s) it will show the user if it recognises that account. I have no other choice other than to select the user and if I try to not select, it will revert to the name it does recognise. I click send to the invitation  but i will then receive back an undeliverable email to say the invite could not be delivered. Using a dummy email address as and example the error is then below  Attempting to email *** Email address is removed for privacy *** and my company is known as comany2  Error: joe.bloggs_company1.co.uk#ext# was not found at company2.org.uk The email did provide some information which suggests "Fix email delivery issues for error code 5.1.10 in office 365" and the way we resolved initially wasto clear the user contact within our tenancy that appeared to be known in full as *** Email address is removed for privacy *** and then attempt to share again. HOWEVER, when this user attempts to access another new folder or an existing which they had access too, we go through the same process.   This is not just a specific user. I am attempting to share around 50 folders as part of this current work with some working and others failing depending on what access they have had previsouly it seems.   Can anyone advise if they have had similar and is there a once and for all fix to this issue, is it a known issue and if there is not a fix, does anyone have a workaround.  Thanks  Mark

test1.content: Since 6/17/2016 our C# backup application has been unable to upload files to our O365 SharePoint site. The code has not changed, nor any credentials, nor any permissions. I can manually access the site and download, upload, delete files, etc. using the same  account that is used by the code, so it appears to be some special case regarding access via the Microsoft.SharePoint.Client API. What is going wrong here, what could have changed in mid-June, and how can we resolve it?  Exception:  Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.ServerUnauthorizedAccessException: Access denied. You do not have permission to perform this action or access this resource.  at Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.ClientRequest.ProcessResponseStream(Stream responseStream)  at Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.ClientRequest.ProcessResponse()  at Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.ClientRequest.ExecuteQueryToServer(ChunkStringBuilder sb)  at Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.ClientRequest.ExecuteQuery()  at Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.ClientRuntimeContext.ExecuteQuery()  at Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.ClientContext.ExecuteQuery()  Pseudocode:  Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.SharePointOnlineCredentials credentials = new SharePointOnlineCredentials(username, password) _context = new Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.ClientContext(webFullUrl); _context.Credentials = credentials; Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.List _list = _context.Web.Lists.GetByTitle(title)  using (Stream volumeStream = File.OpenRead(volume.FullName)) {  Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.FileCreationInformation newFile = new Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.FileCreationInformation();  newFile.ContentStream = volumeStream;  newFile.Url = string.Format(@"{0}\{1}", BackupRootDirectory, volume.Name);  Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.File file =_list.RootFolder.Files.Add(newFile);  _context.ExecuteQuery(); }
test1.title: Microsoft.SharePoint.Client.ServerUnauthorizedAccessException using Microsoft.SharePoint.Client C# API since 6/17/2016

test1.content: Good Afternoon All,  I am trying to run Stssync using a batch file to pull a Contact List from Sharepoint in to Outlook 2013.  I want to be able to do this by using a batch file, because I'd like to create it as a Login Script and roll it out to my domain using a GPO.  If I open Outlook 2013, and paste the Stssync link in to a hyperlink, and click it, the sharepoint list is identified correctly and connects, appearing in my "Other Contacts" list on "People".  However, if I run it in a batch file using the Start iexplorestssync://sts/?ver=1.1&... etc. etc. or the Start outlook.exe /sharestssync://sts/?ver=1.1& I get the error message "The System Cannot Find the File Specified". Outlook will still open, however  the contact list will not appear.  Does anyone have any idea why this doesn't work in a batch file? People that I have spoken to in the past have said that the following command, albeit tweaked to my list, should work:  start iexplore.exe stssync://sts/?ver=version&type=folder-type&cmd=command-name&base-url=sts-url&guid=the-guid&site-name=site-friendly-name&list-name=list-friendly-name&list-url=list-url  Any help greatly appreciated. As I say, I need to be able to execute this as a batch file to be able to roll out via GPO. I appreciate that you can connect via the "Connect to Outlook" button in Sharepoint, but having 200 users do this is not a sensible  idea  Kindest regards,  Liam

test1.content: There's a pretty ugly bug condition in Word related to uploading documents to SharePoint. It seems to also have problems with other applications like PowerPoint and Project as well.   Log into the SharePoint site and choose to upload multiple files(Note that if you highlight one file and the Shift+Click a second file to select a range of files, the interface doesn't appear to be quickly highlighting the range of files as expected. Note that this process seems to be taking longer than should be expected  before the Open button then works. Note that a security alert icon appears in your Taskbar, in theory, it wanted to ask me if I wanted to allow the browser to access local files but I previously told that dialog to not ask me again.)If you click on that security alert icon in the Taskbar you may see that Word has crashed or is crashing and it's trying to lookup advice from MicrosoftPress the Open button to upload the list to SharePoint and then choose the OK button or similar on that dialog box within the browserWord is now in some unhappy state, in fact there are multiple Word instances which are all unhappy.  Attempting then to close each Word instance you get a system modal dialog which states "Changes have been made that affect the global template, Normal.dotm. Do you want to save those changes?" Options include: Save, Don't Save, Cancel and the X in the  upper-right corner. Don't Save produces no response and doesn't dismiss the system modal dialog box as expected. Neither does the Cancel option. And the Save option... still produces no response nor dismisses the system modal dialog box. Only the X dismisses  the dialog box but it doesn't make error state go away.  Attempting then to close the Word instance... displays the system modal dialog box, holding the end-user hostage. It sometimes adds to this a dialog box which indicates "You cannot close Microsoft Word because a dialog box is open. Click OK, switch to  Word, and then close the dialog box." Using Task Manager to attempt to kill the instance produces the same results.  I think I may have finally figured out the right ordering: Task Manager, kill instance, End Task, OK, End Task. This appears to be the method of clearing the error state.  And yet, everytime I upload a collection of files to SharePoint for some reason Office 365 is trying to instantiate separate instances of Word (or PowerPoint or Project or Excel) on a once-per-file basis and in some cases, adjust my Normal.dotm. Why? Guys,  this isn't the way of implementing a cloud-based upload. I'm in the process of uploading a hundred files into SharePoint. The process is really ugly as a result of this deadlock problem that's going on. When you have n instances of Word all trying toupdating the global template they're fighting each other and creating a race condition, presumably. One could ask why you'd want to do so in the first place, what's the benefit?
test1.title: Bugs related to Word uploads to SharePoint and Normal.dotm

test1.content: I have a problem that I don't know the best way to tackle. I feel like there's an easier way than what we do now by using Office 365, but I'm not sure how. Here's my dilemma:  I work in the Box Office at a Performing Arts theatre. We have a large list of people who have subscribed to the next season of shows. Each subscriber has a variety of shows they've subscribed to and different seat locations assigned to them already. Right  now, that data is just in an Excel file. What happens next is that we go into our ticketing system and actually reserve the seats for each subscriber based on what they've been assigned. Currently, we print out the Excel data, which ends up being hundreds  of pages, and work off of that by marking off each order as we go. Printing them out like that opens us up to so many possible problems and errors that I'm sure there has to be a better way. I was thinking of making a Sharepoint site that has all of this  data that multiple people could get to and edit at the same time as they are doing the seating. That way, any changes to be made will be seen by everyone, leaving less room for error. Does anyone have a better idea? I'm not quite sure how to tackle this and would appreciate any help!  Thanks!
test1.title: Best way to share and edit a large list?

test1.content: Hi I have encountered the strangest of problems; We have been using various brand computers for years with no issues, including Dell. We recently purchased a batch of Dell Optiplex 7040 computers with Windows 10 Pro. After a day or two, users started reporting that our O365 Sharepoint sites (e.g. tenantname.sharepoint.com) would become inaccessible. The same browser could still access other sites. Other browsers such as Chrome and Firefox had the same issue. A restart of the PC would often fix it but not always. Some users could go a few days without the issue, others would have the issue immediately. There seemed to be no pattern. We also purchased some new model Dell laptops with Windows 10 Pro and they don't have the issue.  I troubleshooted by trying: different network cables different switch ports different brand switches different DNS servers removal of all IE-related GPOs turned off Sophos antivirus used both DHCP and static IP addresses inserted a different NIC wiped the PC and put a fresh build of Win 10 Pro  The problem still persisted with all the above. The common denominators up to this stage were the same OS (Win 10 Pro) and same router (Cisco 2921). Everything else was changed.  Asus laptops, Surface Pros and other Dell laptops all running Windows 10 Pro on the same network don't appear to have the issue. Only the new Dell desktops. Older model Dell desktops running Win 7 Pro are unaffected.  I then put one of the affected new Dell PCs in my home network and with the limited testing I've been able to do, the problem has so far not appeared. The router used here was possibly the main difference for the success.  We trialled another recent model Dell desktop PC with Win 10 Pro. Initially it was going well then the same problem appeared - it would be unable to access our *.sharepoint.com sites. I placed this PC onto a different network which uses a Cisco 877 router  - instantly it started working again. I cable-swapped it back to the corporate network, it worked for a while then stopped again. Back again on the Cisco 877 network and instantly working.  So logic would say that it appears to be 'something' with Dell desktops, their software/drivers and the Cisco 2921 router that is causing the problem. Is there a network packet, TCP stack, socket or protocol related to sharepoint.com that stops functioning  though this type of router?  Everyone is baffled by this so any help is appreciated.  Thanks
test1.title: Dell Optiplex 7040 Win 10 Pro computers sometimes cannot access sharepoint.com

test1.content: I have run into a problem with SharePoint Online today. I was unable to create or delete content types attached to the same parent content type. To fix the problem related to creating content types I used the script supplied on the link below:  https://www.mavention.nl/blog/confusing-duplicate-content-type-error  I haven't been able to fix the problem related to deleting a content type yet. test1.content: Hi there  So I've created a Discussion page on my School Learning Platform. The idea is for students to post comments and questions. I'm having a little problem with the permission rights though.  I as the owner of the group have full rights on the site. I've grouped all of my students with Read permission which allows them to see the page, but not post a reply. I've taken a look at the permission options and then changed the student group to  have Contribute permission. This solves the issue and allows the students to post replies and comments in the discussion page. But I've very concerned that this has also allowed students to have edit rights on the webpage. Certainly the Edit button now appears  on top of the webpage. Little worried that a student will delete content from the site by accident.   So whats the best thing to do? Can I customise the permission rights at all?  Many Thanks Nick

test1.content: SharePoint List > Ribbon > Export to Excel icon. Windows 10 Office 2016 products Firefox ver 47.0 and Edge I have also disabled my anti-virus to make sure it was not the cause. I recently had some Windows updates and I am wondering it they might have caused this.  This function was working just fine as of a couple of weeks ago. Now when I attempt to export to Excel from an Office365 SharePoint list the following happens:   Dialog box titled "Opening owssvr.dll" pops up.  It wants me to select "Open with Microsoft Excel" or "Save File"    Open with Microsoft Excel:  Excel 2016 from my PCPopup "Microsoft Excel Security Notice" File Path: "C:\Users...\AppData\Local\Temp\owssvr.dll.iqy""Data Connections have been blocked..."I click "enable" The Microsoft account sign in dialog box opens "Sign In" Text box "Type your email address or phone number" I do that and click next.I enter my passwordLast a "Windows Security" dialog box pops up requesting credentials to my PC. However the message is "Connecting to myOffice365Domain" Which is NOT the same as the domain my PC is on.  Entering the credentials for my local domain does not work (of course)Entering the credentials for my Office365 domain does not work (DomainName\UserName entered in dialog box, then password)Eventually it says "Data cannot be saved" and exits. Save File: When I use this option it saves owssvr.dll to the download directory. Completely useless.
test1.title: Office365 SharePoint List Export to Excel

test1.content: Hello, I was wondering if anyone has a solution to implement a 3-month (quarterly) view calendar into SharePoint Online? I did some preliminary digging on the web and only found some workarounds; but they detract from what I am looking for. I would like the SharePoint  Online Calendar to have the ability to view 3 months at the same time, in a vertical display format. If there is no possible way to do this, is there a way to make 3 separate Calendars and put one of top of the other, and force each calendar to have a set  time view?  The way I would envision this is;  { Month 1} *No changes made, uses current month.* { Month 2} *Is locked to display 1 month ahead of Month 1 Calendar.* { Month 3} *Is locked to display 2 months ahead of Month 1 Calendar.*  Is there HTML I could append into a view of one of these months to enforce them to act on those needs, or am I out of luck?
test1.title: SharePoint Quarterly Calendar View?

test1.content: I have a custom list I created to house internal award nominations for employees. I created a workflow for this list, which makes various checks against the state of the nomination form and emails appropriate parties to action (editing the form usually)  and then completes. The editform itself is just the regular out of boxeditform.aspx , which I edited in SharePoint Designer to do some minor row hiding based on whether the current user is also the Created By user for the item; this was done with jQuery and SPServices. Basically  this is because no workflow options actually severed the author's editing permissions (something we want to sever after the item is created for our system).   In the workflow process the award approver is given a linkto the editform for the item. When anyof my test users get this email, and click on the link to go to the editform.aspx they get the error in the title (obviously with all site related information  filled in). I have found "answers" in my google searching, but to be honest I have no idea how to do some of the solutions. I come here to ask that if someone knows how to answer this problem that they answer it in such a step by step method that my 4 year old could  understand it and do it if necessary. Assume I did everything in SPDesigner by complete accident. :)  Thank you for your time and assistance.
test1.title: SP2007 No item exists at http//:..../..../..../....EditForm.aspx?ID=64 It may have been renamed or deleted by another user.

test1.content: Why does Sharepoint document search work so poorly? I'm trying to do a simple search by file name, and would think it would make the first search result the file with that name. Instead, it pulls of dozens of documents that have that name inside the contents  of the document, and lists the document with that file name on like page 5 of my search queries (so I have to scroll through 5 pages to get to it).  I'm trying to look for ways to change search settings but haven't found anything.  I overall believe Sharepoint has very poor usability. When I compare it to searching and using Google Drive/Docs, it rates about 20% as effective.  But I want to see if I'm missing something on configurations/settings that would fix this. Even if I am, I'm really surprised that Sharepoint isn't more usable by default.
test1.title: Microsoft Sharepoint Document Search

test1.content: Within my Team Site, I have a document library with 4 top level folders. Each top level folder has a couple sub folders with files contained within those sub folders. Quick-edit seems to work in my attempt to change the name of a folder, however I  can't rename or edit any part of a file or folder.  The URL that it navigates me to displays the name of the folder that I'm attempting to edit, however I can't see anything but a blank screen with my normal navigation links on the left side of the page and the document library name towards the top.  This issue just appeared out of nowhere a couple of days ago, this strange problem never occurred before.  And it's worth noting that I can check the folder and click files, and then View Properties. This will display the properties, but when I attempt to click Edit Properties, it takes me to that same blank screen. I haven't found any similar issues at all through  all of my online searches in an attempt to troubleshoot this issue.  Any help is much appreciated.
